gr.interamerican.bo2.arch
Interface Provider

All Known Implementing Classes:
ProviderImpl
public interface Provider

Provider is a class that provides the runtime dependent resources to a Bo2 class. Provider is an abstraction of the runtime layer. Any type of resource as a database connection, file handles, etc can be provided by the runtime layer to a Bo2 class.
The ResourceWrapper is the abstraction used for all resources provided by a provider.

Method Summary
 void close()
          Closes all resources of this provider.
<C extends ResourceWrapper>
C
getResource(String resourceName, Class<C> subclass)
          Returns the named ResourceWrapper of a specified type.

          Gets this provider's TransactionManager.
 

Method Detail

getResource

<C extends ResourceWrapper> C getResource(String resourceName,
                                          Class<C> subclass)
                                      throws InitializationException
Returns the named ResourceWrapper of a specified type.

Type Parameters:
C - Type of ResourceWrapper.
Parameters:
subclass - Type of ResourceWrapper.
resourceName - Name that distinguishes the specific resource from other resources of the same type.
Returns:
Returns an instance that implements the specific sub-interface of ResourceWrapper.
Throws:
InitializationException - When this Provider can't return the specified sub-type of ResourceWrapper.

getTransactionManager

TransactionManager getTransactionManager()
Gets this provider's TransactionManager.

Returns:
Returns the transaction manager of this provider.

close

void close()
           throws DataException
Closes all resources of this provider. This method will not call any transaction manager functionality. Transaction management is done explicitly via the transaction manager. This method does only cleanup of the resources.

Throws:
DataException
